main event: On October 5, 1955, in Baltimore, Maryland, a bright white light was observed traveling in a flat trajectory from west to east before disappearing with no sound or trail.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 2 minutes, and only one object was reported.
The object was described as the size of a star and as bright as a star.
It was noted that the object did not leave a trail and did not make any noise.
The weather conditions at the nearby airport did not seem to explain the sighting.
The report considered the possibility of the object being a balloon or aircraft.
